intro: Alsine schimperi, commonly known as Schimper's alsike, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
